Event.0: Gwendolyn Brooks, a Pulitzer Prize-winning poet and author who spoke of and to the everyday struggles and triumphs of African Americans, died in Chicago.
Event.1: Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev and US President George H. W. Bush, declare the Cold War over
Event.2: Bhopal disaster: Union Carbide pesticide plant leak 45 tons of methyl isocyanate and other toxic compounds in Bhopal, India, kills 2,259 (official figure) - other estimates as high as 16,000 (including later deaths) and over half a million injured
Event.3: Oldest groom - Harry Stevens, 103, weds Thelma Lucas, 83, in Wisconsin
Event.4:
Gas leak in Bhopal, India
On this day in 1984, a gas leak from a Union Carbide plant in Bhopal, India, spread over a populated area, resulting ultimately in 15,000 to 20,000 deaths and leaving some half million survivors with chronic medical ailments.

Event.17: Edward Elgar's 1st Symphony in A performed by the Hallé Orchestra conducted by Hans Richter, premieres in Manchester, England
Event.18: Anna Freud, a founder of child psychoanalysis and one of its foremost practitioners, was born in Vienna.
Event.19: In a battle during the American Civil War, Federal troops ousted the Confederates from Salem, Missouri.
Event.20: English writer Joseph Conrad, whose notable works included the novel Lord Jim (1900) and the novella Heart of Darkness (1902), was born.
Event.21: After hastily constructing a fortification and barricading themselves inside, miners (“diggers”) working in the Eureka goldfield in Victoria, Australia, opened fire on government forces surrounding the stockade, the culmination of long-standing grievances on the part of the diggers.
Event.22: Eureka Stockade: In what is claimed by many to be the birth of Australian democracy, more than 20 goldminers at Ballarat, Victoria, are killed by state troopers in an uprising over mining licences
Event.23: Illinois was admitted as the 21st state of the United States of America.
Event.24: German composer Johann Sebastian Bach married his second wife, Anna Magdalena Wilcken, the daughter of a trumpeter at Weissenfels.
Event.25: Sir Thomas Herriot introduces potatoes to England from Colombia
Event.26: St. Francis Xavier, the leading Roman Catholic missionary of modern times, died of fever off the coast of China.
